name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & Work Pack
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, Work Pack
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

○ Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with Clause 204.04
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Topsoil stripped to full width of the formation and placed in approved stockpile location. Stockpile shaped to shed water and stripped surfaces graded to be self draining. Topsoil shall not be removed from site unless approved by the superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type A material shall comply with the requirements of Table 204.041 and shall be free of topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter.
○ Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type A material without stablisation to the satisfaction of the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent satisfied with Stabilisation, Signed ITP/ records

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type B material shall be free of topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter. Type B shall have a minimum assigned CBR >5% and Assigned Percent Swell < 2.5%. Materials with swell greater than 2.5% can only be used as Type B material if approved by the superintendent.
FREQUENCY: Prior construction of the regulating layer
○ Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be presented to Superintendent for review.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ Document Review
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent acceptance, Signed ITP
○ Where Unsuitable material is encountered, proposed in-situ treatment must be submitted to the superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off, Work Procedure

○ Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the superintendent and submit proposed action for review. The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off, Work Procedure
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173, before proceeding to subbase construction.

○ The Contractor shall submit a test rolling procedure to the Superintendent including the method of preparing an area for test rolling, the extent of test rolling and a requirement to provide not less than 24 hours notice of the location and commencement time for the test rolling to the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level = minimum compaction 99% MDD.
○ Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material = minimum compaction 99% MDD.
○ Type B material 400mm below the top of Type B material and Top 150mm of where fill is to be constructed = minimum compaction 97% MDD.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records, Lot Register
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Reference Documents for particular Frequency of Testing and Material Properties Testing Requirements.
○ Table 204.161 for Project Specific Scales for each applicable Road Name or Area.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Test Records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
